summary.span: 为实现 的线程安全集合提供阻塞和限制功能。

span.span: Provides blocking and bounding capabilities for thread-safe collections that implement .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一个线程安全集合类，可提供以下功能： is a thread-safe collection class that provides the following: - 生产者/使用者模式中; 实现是包装器接口。An implementation of the producer/consumer pattern; is a wrapper for the interface. - 并发添加和删除的项具有多个线程从和方法。Concurrent addition and removal of items from multiple threads with the and methods. - 绑定的集合，阻止和完整或为空集合时的操作。A bounded collection that blocks and operations when the collection is full or empty. - 取消或通过使用操作对象在或方法。Cancellation of or operations by using a object in the or method. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此类型实现接口。This type implements the interface. 在使用完类型后，您应直接或间接释放类型。When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型，调用其中的方法`try` / `catch`块。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息，请参阅中的"使用实现 IDisposable 的对象"部分接口主题。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. 另请注意，方法不是线程安全。Also, note that the method is not thread-safe. 所有其他公共和受保护的成员是线程安全的可从多个线程同时使用。All other public and protected members of are thread-safe and may be used concurrently from multiple threads. 表示允许的线程安全添加和删除数据的集合。 represents a collection that allows for thread-safe adding and removal of data. 用作的包装器实例，并允许从集合删除尝试进行阻止，直到数据是可供移除。 is used as a wrapper for an instance, and allows removal attempts from the collection to block until data is available to be removed. 同样，你可以创建强制实施中允许的数据元素的数目上限; 空间之前可用于存储添加的项，然后可能会阻止添加到集合的尝试。Similarly, you can create a to enforce an upper bound on the number of data elements allowed in the ; addition attempts to the collection may then block until space is available to store the added items. 这种方式，类似于传统阻止队列数据结构，只是基础的数据存储机制作为抽象出来。In this manner, is similar to a traditional blocking queue data structure, except that the underlying data storage mechanism is abstracted away as an . 支持限制和阻塞。 supports bounding and blocking. 边界表示你已可以将集合的最大容量。Bounding means that you can set the maximum capacity of the collection. 边界非常重要在某些情况下，因为它使您能够控制在内存中，集合的最大大小，它可防止生成线程移动太快之前使用的线程。多个线程或任务可以将项添加到集合并发，并如果集合达到其指定最大容量，生成的线程将阻塞，直到移除项。Bounding is important in certain scenarios because it enables you to control the maximum size of the collection in memory, and it prevents the producing threads from moving too far ahead of the consuming threads.Multiple threads or tasks can add items to the collection concurrently, and if the collection reaches its specified maximum capacity, the producing threads will block until an item is removed. 多个使用者可以同时移除项，如果集合变空，则使用线程将发生阻塞，直到制造者添加某个项。Multiple consumers can remove items concurrently, and if the collection becomes empty, the consuming threads will block until a producer adds an item. 生成的线程可以调用方法，以指示将添加更多的项。A producing thread can call the method to indicate that no more items will be added. 使用者将监视 属性以了解集合何时为空且不再添加项。Consumers monitor the property to know when the collection is empty and no more items will be added. 和通常在循环中执行操作。 and operations are typically performed in a loop. 你可以通过传入取消循环对象传递给或方法，，然后检查令牌的值每个迭代上的属性。You can cancel a loop by passing in a object to the or method, and then checking the value of the token's property on each iteration. 如果值为`true`，它将由您来通过清理任何资源和退出循环做出响应取消请求。If the value is `true`, it is up to you to respond the cancellation request by cleaning up any resources and exiting the loop. 当你创建对象，你可以指定的限定的容量不仅集合的类型使用。When you create a object, you can specify not only the bounded capacity but also the type of collection to use. 例如，可以指定对象的先进先出 (FIFO) 行为，或后进先出 (LIFO) 行为的对象。For example, you could specify a object for first in, first out (FIFO) behavior, or a object for last in, first out (LIFO) behavior. 可使用实现 接口的任何集合类。You can use any collection class that implements the interface. 的默认集合类型为 。The default collection type for is . 不要直接修改基础集合。Do not modify the underlying collection directly. 使用方法来添加或删除元素。Use methods to add or remove elements. 对象可能会被破坏，如果您直接更改基础集合。The object can become corrupted if you change the underlying collection directly. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何添加和取出同时从当前阻塞集合的项：The following example shows how to add and take items concurrently from a blocking collection: [!code-csharp[System.Collections.Concurrent.BlockingCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.collections.concurrent.blockingcollection/cs/blockingcoll.cs#1)] remarks.format: ## Remarks CopyTo 表示集合中一个准确时间点处的时间的快照。CopyTo represents a snapshot of the collection at a precise point in time. 如果其他线程可添加或删除项，执行 CopyTo 时，所返回的 CopyTo 元素可能无法反映该集合的状态。If other threads are adding or removing items while CopyTo is executing, then the elements returned by CopyTo might not represent the state of the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `Dispose`方法不是线程安全。The `Dispose` method is not thread-safe. 在完成使用 `Dispose` 后，应调用 。Call `Dispose` when you are finished using the . `Dispose` 方法使 处于不可用状态。The `Dispose` method leaves the in an unusable state. 在调用`Dispose`，必须释放对所有引用以便垃圾回收器才能回收的内存，占用。After calling `Dispose`, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 有关详细信息，请参阅[清洗向上非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)和[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). > [!NOTE] > 每次释放对 `Dispose` 的最后一个引用前，均应调用 。Always call `Dispose` before you release your last reference to the . 否则，在垃圾回收器调用 对象的 `Finalize` 方法之前，该对象正在使用的资源不会被释放。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's `Finalize` method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法使客户端代码能够通过使用 foreach 循环 （对于每个在 Visual Basic)，从集合中移除项或或 PLINQ 查询。This method enables client code to remove items from the collection by using a foreach loop (For Each in Visual Basic), or or a PLINQ query. 枚举数将继续执行，提供项 （如果存在） 直至，则返回 true，并且如果为 false 的循环块直到项变得可用，或者直到已取消。The enumerator will continue to provide items (if any exist) until returns true, and if is false the loop blocks until an item becomes available or until the is cancelled.
